Recognizing the symptoms of polycythemia, including an increased ESR, is crucial. Polycythemia is a rare blood disorder characterized by an overproduction of red blood cells. This can lead to an increase in the ESR, or erythrocyte sedimentation rate, which is a measure of how quickly red blood cells settle to the bottom of a test tube.

The underlying cause of the increased ESR in this case is the excess production of red blood cells in polycythemia. This condition can also cause other symptoms such as fatigue, weakness, and shortness of breath.

Based on this information, the correct answer is (C) Polycythemia.
